Sentencas: (Mn,CO)(3)O(4) spinel with a nominal composition of Mn(1.5)Co(1.5)O(4) demonstrates excellent electrical conductivity, satisfactory thermal and structural stability, as well as good thermal expansion match to ferritic stainless steel interconnects.
Titulo: (Mn,Co)3O4 spinel coatings on ferritic stainless steels for SOFC interconnect applications

Sentencas: A slurry-coating technique was developed for fabricating the spinel coatings onto the steel interconnects.
Titulo: (Mn,Co)3O4 spinel coatings on ferritic stainless steels for SOFC interconnect applications
(Mn,Co)3O4 spinel coatings on ferritic stainless steels for SOFC interconnect applications

Sentencas: not only significantly decreased the contact resistance between a LSF cathode and stainless steel interconnect, but also acted as a mass barrier to inhibit scale growth on the stainless steel and to prevent Cr outward migration through the coating.
Titulo: (Mn,Co)3O4 spinel coatings on ferritic stainless steels for SOFC interconnect applications

Sentencas: The level of improvement in electrical performance and oxidation resistance (i.e. the scale growth rate) was dependent on the ferritic substrate composition.
Titulo: (Mn,Co)3O4 spinel coatings on ferritic stainless steels for SOFC interconnect applications

Sentencas: For E-brite and Crofer22 APU, with a relatively high Cr concentration (27 wt% and 23%, respectively) and negligible Si, the reduction of contact ASR and scale growth on the ferritic substrates was significant.
Titulo: (Mn,Co)3O4 spinel coatings on ferritic stainless steels for SOFC interconnect applications

Sentencas: In comparison, limited improvement was achieved by application of the Mn(1.5)CO(1.5)O(4) spinel coating on AISI430, which contains only 17%Cr and a higher amount of residual Si.
Titulo: (Mn,Co)3O4 spinel coatings on ferritic stainless steels for SOFC interconnect applications
